question: 震災
sourceMnemonic: An <kanji>earthquake</kanji> <kanji>disaster</kanji> is just that, an <vocabulary>earthquake disaster</vocabulary>. These are no good.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. The reading for <ja>災</ja> is the <ja>さい</ja> reading because *<reading>sigh</reading>* earthquakes suck man.
